Posted By: Robface (7/8/2011 1:07:20 PM)

posts.post_content:
Iconic black removal 5/5  
  
black: destruction [doom blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=doom blade)  
white: exile [path to exile](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=path to exile)  
red: burn [lightning bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=lightning bolt)  
blue: counter [counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=counterspell)  
green: combat tricks (!?) [giant growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=giant growth)  
  
EDIT:  
@TheMurderousKitten   
  
I totally agree on that point.   
It was more meant like its a classic black MECHANIC - i know that its not classic in the sense of "old".  
The examples i chose were the ones that (on my opinion) are the best/most commonly used nowadays for each mechanic/color. (although "best" is relative, i know - you get the idea)  
Thats the reason why there is [doom blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=doom blade) in ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) and [counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=counterspell) in ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) on my list.   
  
But i agree that the wording "classic" is surely a little bit misleading - deleted it :)
posts.html:
Iconic black removal 5/5

black: destruction doom blade
white: exile path to exile
red: burn lightning bolt
blue: counter counterspell
green: combat tricks (!?) giant growth

EDIT:
@TheMurderousKitten

I totally agree on that point.
It was more meant like its a classic black MECHANIC - i know that its not classic in the sense of "old".
The examples i chose were the ones that (on my opinion) are the best/most commonly used nowadays for each mechanic/color. (although "best" is relative, i know - you get the idea)
Thats the reason why there is doom blade in and counterspell in on my list.

But i agree that the wording "classic" is surely a little bit misleading - deleted it :)

posts.post_content:
Random conversation that really came up one day at lunch:
  
   
 Friend 1: If you were to kill yourself, how'd you do it?
  
 Me (playing Magic): I'd [Banefire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Banefire) myself.
  
 Friend 2: Lol, we weren't talking about Magic.
  
 Friend 1: You know, I think I'd Doom Blade myself.
  
 Friend 2: You can't. You're immune to Doom Blade.
  
 \*general lulz"
  
   
If you get it, you've either been playing too much Magic or listening to too many racist jokes.
posts.html:
Random conversation that really came up one day at lunch:

Friend 1: If you were to kill yourself, how'd you do it?
Me (playing Magic): I'd Banefire myself.
Friend 2: Lol, we weren't talking about Magic.
Friend 1: You know, I think I'd Doom Blade myself.
Friend 2: You can't. You're immune to Doom Blade.
*general lulz"

If you get it, you've either been playing too much Magic or listening to too many racist jokes.

Posted By: Lash_of_Dragonbreath (11/29/2011 6:55:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
*Destroy target comment section by mentioning this spell does what it is suppose to do. It can not be regenerated and everyone will hate you.*  
  
  
@Kryptnyt  
That's very doubtful as we have in Standard right now (not counting Doom Blade):  
  
[Dismember](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dismember)  
[Victim of Night](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Victim of Night)  
[Go for the Throat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Go for the Throat)  
[Grasp of Darkness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grasp of Darkness)  
Plus a few others that could be arguably better to run over terror.  
  
All of which do Terror's job much better than it can in most cases. It would be like having [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt) and [Incinerate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Incinerate) in the same set or [Burst Lightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burst Lightning) and [Shock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shock). the latter would be pretty much a waste of a card slot as Bolt outclasses it. 2013 MIGHT be able to bring it back as everything but Victim will rotate out and the format will probably be a lot less artifact heavy.
posts.html:
Destroy target comment section by mentioning this spell does what it is suppose to do. It can not be regenerated and everyone will hate you.


@Kryptnyt
That's very doubtful as we have in Standard right now (not counting Doom Blade):

Dismember
Victim of Night
Go for the Throat
Grasp of Darkness
Plus a few others that could be arguably better to run over terror.

All of which do Terror's job much better than it can in most cases. It would be like having Lightning Bolt and Incinerate in the same set or Burst Lightning and Shock. the latter would be pretty much a waste of a card slot as Bolt outclasses it. 2013 MIGHT be able to bring it back as everything but Victim will rotate out and the format will probably be a lot less artifact heavy.

posts.post_content: I really think that this card is much better than Go For The Throat. What can you kill with GFTT that you can't kill with this? ...Grave Titan. But that's about it. GFTT was printed in an all-artifact block, so it's naturally less effective than it should've been. They're both easily 4.5 star cards, but I prefer this one.
